lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/jeenius.jeenius.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run jeenius.jeenius.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

Jeenius is your all-in-one desktop smart task manager application.
Simply refer to all available features below and type the command you wish to use into the text box.
* Words in UPPER_CASE are descriptions/date&time that you will add
* Dates should be in the format `d/M/yyyy HHmm` (e.g. `21/2/2025 2359`)
You can add 3 types of tasks:
How to use:  deadline DESCRIPTION /by d/M/yyyy HHmm
How to use:  event DESCRIPTION /from d/M/yyyy HHmm /to d/M/yyyy HHmm
View all your tasks in the form of a list
Find tasks easily by searching keywords
Keep track of what you have done by marking/unmarking tasks
Easily view your tasks in chronological order by using this function
Quit the program by using this command

* Represents a Deadline task that extends generic Task class.

* @param by Deadline's completion by date and time in "d/M/yyyy HHmm" format
* Represents an Event task that extends generic Task class.

<Button fx:id="sortButton" layoutX="10" layoutY="10" onAction="#handleSortButtonClick" prefWidth="60.0" text="Sort" AnchorPane.leftAnchor="10.0" AnchorPane.topAnchor="10.0" />

<ScrollPane fx:id="scrollPane" fitToWidth="true" hbarPolicy="NEVER" layoutX="10" layoutY="50" prefHeight="500.0" prefWidth="380.0" vvalue="1.0" AnchorPane.bottomAnchor="50.0" AnchorPane.leftAnchor="10.0" AnchorPane.rightAnchor="10.0" AnchorPane.topAnchor="50.0">

<TextField fx:id="userInput" layoutX="10" layoutY="560" onAction="#handleUserInput" prefHeight="30.0" prefWidth="300.0" promptText="Click here to type something..." AnchorPane.bottomAnchor="10.0" AnchorPane.leftAnchor="10.0" AnchorPane.rightAnchor="90.0" />
<Button fx:id="sendButton" layoutX="320" layoutY="560" onAction="#handleUserInput" prefHeight="30.0" prefWidth="70.0" text="Send" AnchorPane.bottomAnchor="10.0" AnchorPane.rightAnchor="10.0" />
